meanings.definition: The act of picking up or collecting something.
meanings.sent1: After the party, the quick pickups of trash made the place clean again.
meanings.sent2: She made several pickups of fallen leaves in the garden.
meanings.sent3: His pickups of seashells along the shore amused the children.
meanings.sent4: Her pickups of new words during the conversation were impressive.
meanings.sent5: The pickups of colorful stones in the park were a delightful sight.

meanings.definition: A small truck with an open back for transporting goods.
meanings.sent1: The company used pickups to deliver packages to customers.
meanings.sent2: He loaded the pickups with fresh produce from the farm.
meanings.sent3: The pickups racing down the road looked like busy ants.
meanings.sent4: The pickups lined up at the market, ready for a day of work.
meanings.sent5: The shiny pickups in the parking lot caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A device on a guitar that converts vibrations into electrical signals.
meanings.sent1: The musician adjusted the pickups on his guitar for better sound.
meanings.sent2: She installed new pickups on her guitar to enhance the tone.
meanings.sent3: The pickups on the guitar seemed to whisper secrets to the audience.
meanings.sent4: His guitar pickups hummed with energy during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The pickups on the guitar transformed the music into magic.
